outline.title: Title Slide
outline.summary: Title slide introducing Florence for Isaac Health as an AI-powered dementia care navigation solution.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/HG8xVQtZ0dyb.jpg - The title slide introduces AI-Powered Dementia Care Navigation. Image 10 shows a brain graphic with AI concepts related to dementia care, which is highly relevant.

outline.title: A Day in the Life: The Isaac Health Care Manager
outline.summary: Depicts the daily reality of an Isaac Health care manager: 150+ patients, 20-minute chart prep per call, missed discharges, and constant firefighting. Establishes the pain point before introducing Florence.

outline.title: The Independence Cliff—A One-Way Journey
outline.summary: Margaret Chen's story illustrating the journey from home to institutional care after hospitalization.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/diagrams_png/03_independence_cliff_journey.png - This slide details the "Independence Cliff" with specific statistics and a patient story. Image 2 is a custom infographic that visually represents the statistics and the concept of the cliff, making it the most appropriate choice.

outline.title: Meet Florence—Context-Aware & Clinically Safe
outline.summary: Introduction to Florence's three pillars: Knows, Escalates, and Sounds Human.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/VF33rvDk5q4C.png - This slide introduces Florence, an AI nurse. Image 14 is a professional-looking graphic of an AI robot/nurse, which visually represents the concept of Florence. Image 7 is also a good option, but 14 is a clearer depiction of an AI nurse. Re-selecting 14.

outline.title: The Caregiver Burden Cascade
outline.summary: Explaining how caregiver stress leads to increased hospitalization risk using odds ratios.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/diagrams_png/04_caregiver_burden_impact.png - This slide focuses on the Caregiver Burden Cascade. Image 6 is a custom infographic that visually represents the cascade and the associated statistics, making it the best fit.

outline.title: The Power of the Three-Way Call
outline.summary: Diagram showing the unified communication ecosystem connecting patient, caregiver, and care manager.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/diagrams_png/05_three_way_call_flow.png - This slide explains the "Three-Way Call" concept. Image 3 is a custom infographic that perfectly illustrates the three-way connection between Patient, Caregiver, and Care Manager via Florence.

outline.title: The Florence AI Care Coordination Ecosystem
outline.summary: Visualizing the hybrid model of in-visit scribe and between-visit coordinator.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/diagrams_png/06_ai_care_coordination_ecosystem.png - This slide describes the Florence AI Care Coordination Ecosystem. Image 4 is a custom infographic that clearly breaks down the two modes (In-Visit Scribe and Between-Visit Coordinator) and the before/after comparison.

outline.title: Florence Supports the Caregiver, Too
outline.summary: Linda Chen scenario showing how Florence detects caregiver burnout signals and triggers proactive support interventions
outline.image_plan: No image needed - use the detect → screen → act workflow visualization

outline.title: What Florence Does for Isaac Health Patients
outline.summary: Benefits for patients, providers, and Isaac Health, focusing on proactive care and retention.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/pmm8X3kLRKgJ.jpg - This slide describes what Florence does for patients and providers. Image 13 shows a caregiver and a senior in a home setting, representing the in-home care aspect of Florence's monitoring.

outline.title: Three Pathways: How Isaac Health Can Start With Florence
outline.summary: A 3-column visual showing Co-pilot Enabler (lowest risk, weeks 1-4), Hybrid (medium risk, months 2-3), and Full Autonomous (higher risk, month 4+) implementation options with risk levels and timelines.
outline.image_plan: No images needed - use icon-based visual design with shield/scales/rocket metaphors for each pathway

outline.title: Florence Behavioral Coaching in Action
outline.summary: Concrete example showing how Florence detects increased wandering (2x/week to 5x/week), generates structured documentation, and escalates with behavioral alert to care manager with specific recommendations.
outline.image_plan: No images needed - use conversation flow visualization with Florence quote box

outline.title: Florence's Escalation Protocol: Safety Guardrails Built In
outline.summary: Multi-tiered escalation ladder showing triggers (high-risk keywords, suicidal ideation, behavioral crisis, confusion) mapped to responses (RN escalation, PHQ-9 screening, caregiver call) and outcomes.
outline.image_plan: No images needed - use color-coded escalation ladder visualization

outline.title: Florence Sidebar: Works Alongside Your Existing Platform
outline.summary: Visual showing the Florence Copilot Chrome extension sidebar operating alongside Isaac Health's proprietary Care Platform - no new logins, care managers stay in their workflow.

outline.title: Florence Multiplies Your Care Team's Capacity by 8-10x
outline.summary: Comparison of capacity and reach rates before and after implementing Florence.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/A1giR7UNWC4P.jpg - This slide discusses multiplying the care team's capacity. Image 12 shows a caregiver supporting a senior, which relates to the capacity and support theme. Alternatively, a graphic showing scale or efficiency would be better. Selecting 12 for the human element of care capacity.

outline.title: Florence Supports Isaac Health's GUIDE Model Compliance
outline.summary: Shows how Florence enables each of the 6 GUIDE model pillars: Comprehensive Assessment, Personalized Care Planning, Medication Management, Caregiver Support, 24/7 Access, and Respite Coordination

outline.title: Florence Closes Care Gaps & Drives HEDIS Compliance
outline.summary: Horizontal grid showing 4 key HEDIS measures (DSF-E, PDC, DRR-E, COA) with star weights, industry baselines, Florence automation capabilities, and Isaac Health impact. Bottom callout shows 10x combined star weight and $350K-$600K annual quality bonus value.
outline.image_plan: No images needed - use horizontal grid layout with star icons and checkmarks

outline.title: Projected Impact: Clinical Outcomes & Financial ROI
outline.summary: Consolidated slide merging clinical outcomes (20-30% readmission reduction, 50% medication adherence improvement) with corrected financial ROI ($1,350/patient × 3,000 = $4.05M annual savings, 1.125x ROI).

outline.title: 90-Day Pilot: Your Path to Confident Deployment
outline.summary: Detailed 4-phase pilot timeline: Phase 1 (Weeks 1-2) Setup & Integration, Phase 2 (Weeks 3-4) Co-Pilot Launch with 50 patients, Phase 3 (Weeks 5-8) Hybrid Mode with 100 patients, Phase 4 (Weeks 9-12) Evaluation & Scale Decision. Includes specific milestones and success criteria.
outline.image_plan: No images needed - use horizontal timeline visualization with 4 phases

outline.title: Our Partnership—Your Brand, Your Protocols
outline.summary: Emphasizing the strategic partnership model with customization, white-labeling, and ongoing optimization.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/QdFsqTHLKejb.jpg - This slide is about the partnership and customization. Image 8 shows a senior interacting with a friendly robot, symbolizing the personalized, branded AI care (Florence) being integrated.

outline.title: Why Isaac Health Should Act Now
outline.summary: Three converging pressures creating urgency: quality measures, patient expectations, and workforce burnout.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/egyDs6mHdMIC.png - This slide urges immediate action due to converging pressures. Image 18 is a project implementation diagram, which relates to the urgency of starting the project now.

outline.title: Contact & Q&A
outline.summary: Closing slide with contact information and final tagline.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/diagrams_png/04_caregiver_burden_impact.png - This is the contact and Q&A slide. Image 7 is a clean, professional image of an AI robot, which reinforces the core product (Florence) in the closing slide.
